Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. \(14ab^2-8ab^2 =\) ________

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 6.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(6ab^2\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \(5xy^2+7xy^2 =\) ________

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 6.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(12xy^2\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \((7b^2-2b-12)-(4b^2+9b-7) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 6.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(3b^2-11b-5\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \( (7mn^3-2m^2n-12mn)-(3mn^3-4mn) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 6.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(4mn^3-2m^2n-8mn\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \( (r^3-r^2s)-2(rs^2+s^3)+(r^2s+2rs^2) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 6.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(r^3-2s^3\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

Use the following polynomial functions to answer questions 6–10.

  • \(p(x) = 12x^2+3x-4\)
  • \(d(x) = 3x^2-11x-6\)
  1. \( p(4) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 6.1.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 200. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \(d(-3) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 6.1.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 54. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \(p(x) + d(x) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 6.1.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(15x^2-8x-10\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \(p(x) - d(x) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 6.1.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(9x^2+14x+2\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. \( p(5) - d(-6) =\) ___________

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 6.1.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 143. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
